MATH 138: x -> f(x)
MATH 237: (x, y) -> f(x, y) or (x, y, z) -> f(x, y, z)
Output: Real number

Definition: A scalar function f is a rule which assigns each ordered pair of real numbers (x, y) in a set D (called the domain) in R2 a unique real number z = f(x, y). The set is the range.

May 4, 2016 - Lecture 2
